quizzes.question: list-style-type applies to:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The list-style-type Property [/h1] The CSS list properties allow us to set different list item markers. In HTML, there are two types of lists: [b]unordered lists[/b] (
    ) - the list items are marked with bullets [b]ordered lists[/b] (
      ) - the list items are marked with numbers or letters With CSS, lists can be styled further, and images can be used as the list item marker. One of the ways is to use the [b]list-style-type[/b] property, which can be set to [b]circle[/b], [b]square[/b], [b]decimal[/b], [b]disc[/b], [b]lower-alpha[/b], etc. [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]
      1. Red
      2. Green
      3. Blue
      • Red
      • Green
      • Blue
      • Red
      • Green
      • Blue
      [/code] [b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="553"]ol.lower-alpha { [b] [/b]list-style-type:[b] lower-alpha; [/b]} ul.circle { [b] [/b]list-style-type:[b] circle;[/b] } ul.square { list-style-type:[b] square;[/b] }[/code] [b]Result: [/b] [img id="2634" width="100%"] [note]Some of the values are for unordered lists, and some for ordered lists.[/note]

quizzes.question: Which keyword is used to specify the image location address for the list-style-image property?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The List Image and Position[/h1] There are also other list properties, such as: [b]list-style-image[/b] - specifies an image to be used as the list item marker. [b]list-style-position[/b] - specifies the position of the marker box (inside, outside). In the example below, we use an image as the list item marker, and specify the position to be inside of the content flow. [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]

The following list has list-style-position: inside.

  • Red
  • Green
  • Blue
[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="554"]ul { [b]list-style-image: url[/b]("logo.jpg"); [b]list-style-position: inside;[/b] }[/code] [b]Result: [/b] [img id="2635" width="100%"] [note]"list-style-position: [b]outside[/b]" is the default value.[/note]
